bibl.title: Answer of Susanna Bacon
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

org.orgName: United States. Circuit Court (District of Columbia)

div2.p: The return of Susanna Bacon wife of Ebenezer Bacon to the writ of Habeas Corpus from the Circuit Court of the District of Columbia at Washington- directed to her and to Nehemiah Hicks

The said Susanna Bacon alleges that she was born in the Town of Alexandria and has resided ever since her birth- That on the 27th day of November 1827 before her marriage with the said Ebenezer Bacon she purchased a slave named Catherine being as she suppose and believes she same which is designated by this name of Kitty in the said writ of Habeas Corpus from one McKenzie Talbot and that she has ever since held & holds the said Catherine a slave in called Kitty as her property and believes herself to be bona fide entitled to hold her as such-
That since her said marriage she has held her under the provisions of a marriage settlement made between the said Ebenezer Bacon and her the said Susanna-

The said Susanna answered that her right to the said slave which she claims and hold as her property cannot be affected in any manner by any trial judgement or decision of your Honourable Court in any case wherein she was not seen named or did not appear as a party to contest any claim, or defend her right to the said slave & cannot be tried, either under a pretext of a claim freedom by this said slave, or otherwise, except according to the laws of this County of Alexandria- and especially that a right of property can
cannot be tried under a writ of Habeas Corpus and she does show from except to the jurisdiction of this Court in the matter aforesaid-

This day came Susan Bacon before the subscriber a Justice of the peace of the County Alexandria and made oath that the matters in the foregoing return stated are true- given under my name this 28th June 1832
Adam Lynn
The Return of Susanna Bacon to the writ of Habeas Corpus from the Circuit Court of the Dis of Col. to produce Negro Kitty
